1.title: Cartman Gets an Anal Probe
1.description: While the boys are waiting for the school bus, Eric Cartman explains what he perceives to be a nightmare he had the previous night. His supposed nightmare that is later revealed as reality involved alien visitors abducting him and probing him when he went to bed. Cartman's friends, Kyle Broflovski and Stan Marsh, try to convince him that his dream was a reality. Meanwhile, aliens abduct Ike Broflovski.

2.title: Weight Gain 4000
2.description: Cartman 'wins' an essay contest and Kathie Lee Gifford is set to visit South Park to award him the prize, much to the jealousy of Wendy. Meanwhile, Mr. Garrison decides to get his own back on Kathie Lee Gifford with the help of Mr. Hat by attempting to shoot her from the Book Depository, but in the end, fails, killing Kenny.

3.title: Volcano
3.description: The boys go on a hunting trip with Stan Marsh's uncle Jimbo Kern and his friend, Ned Gerblansky. After going through stress, jealousy, and hatred in the episode, Randy Marsh, the town geologist, discovers a severe volcanic threat to the town.

4.title: Big Gay Al's Big Gay Boat Ride
4.description: Stan's new dog, Sparky, comes across as potentially gay. He seeks advice, but finds none in the usual places. Meanwhile, the South Park Elementary football team, The Cows, has an upcoming game on the schedule against their biggest rivals, The Middle Park Cowboys, and Jimbo and Ned decide to bet on it.

5.title: An Elephant Makes love to a pig
5.description: Kyle's mom won't let him keep his new pet, an elephant, because it's so huge. The boys therefore turn to Dr. Mephesto to genetically engineer a smaller elephant.

6.title: Death
6.description: On his grandfather's 102nd birthday, Stan is faced with a moral dilemma -- Grandpa's sole birthday wish is for him to assist him in suicide. Sheila Broflovski has organized a protest against the boys' favorite TV show, The Terrance & Phillip Show, and the parents of South Park have joined her protest against the big city's network headquarters.

7.title: Pinkeye
7.description: Trick-or-treat in South Park is interrupted by an outbreak of pinkeye. While Stan, Kyle and Cartman are getting themselves ready for the school's Halloween party and costume contest, a mishap at the morgue transforms the residents of South Park into brain-eating zombies. The kids have to save the day before they can get down to the business of getting candy.

8.title: Starvin' Marvin
8.description: While trying to get a free promotional digital sports watch, the boys end up contacting an organization that helps starving children in Africa. Mistaking Cartman for a starving African child, government authorities send him to Ethiopia. Adding chaos to confusion, a flock of wild turkeys revolt after their treatment at the hands of the local genetic engineer. South Park is at the mercy of genetically altered turkeys.

9.title: Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo
9.description: Believe in Mr. Hankey! While South Park Elementary is attempting to stage a non-denominational holiday play that won't offend (Or entertain) anyone, Kyle has checked himself into the South Park Mental House. It's Christmas time in South Park and in this landmark episode, an unlikely hero saves the day.

10.title: Damien
10.description: As Cartman's birthday approaches, a new student transfers into the boys' class. His arrival signifies the foretold battle between Jesus and Satan, which may ruin the birthday party.

11.title: Tom Rhinoplasty
11.description: While Mr. Garrison deserts the class for a visit to Tom's Rhinoplasty, Stan, Kyle, Kenny, and Cartman all compete for the attention of Ms. Ellen, the new substitute teacher.

12.title: Mecha-Streisand
characters: Quadriplegic Swiss Man on a Pony
12.description: The dawn of Zinthar is at hand! The boys' discovery of a prehistoric relic spawns a monster that threatens to destroy South Park and the world. Help is on the way, however, in the form of an award-winning actor, a celebrated movie critic, and a rock superstar. But are they enough to overcome the terror of Mecha-Streisand?

13.title: Cartman's Mom is a Dirty Slut
13.description: Eric Cartman is in search of his father but no one is owning up to the job. Could it be Chef? Or is it Mr. Garrison? Or the 1989 Denver Broncos? It could be anyone who attended South Park's 12th Annual Drunken Barn Dance. Cartman just has to know, and only an expensive genetic test stands between him and the true identity of his father. Stan, Kyle, and America's Stupidest Home Videos might be the answer to Cartman's prayers.

1.title: Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus
1.description: Terrance and Phillip travel to Iran to rescue Terrance's little daughter, Sally, who's been held, prisoner. A complex chain of events involving a female pop vocalist, a Middle Eastern dictator, and chemical warfare leads to a hostile takeover of Canada. It's up to Terrance and Phillip to save Sally and their country.

2.title: Cartman's Mom is Still a Dirty Slut
2.description: Just as Mephesto is about to reveal the identity of Eric Cartman's father, the genetic engineer is shot by a mysterious gunman. While the boys wait for Mephesto to regain consciousness, a blizzard hits South Park and the citizens are stranded for hours on end without food.

3.title: Chickenlover
3.description: A series of heinous crimes involving chickens leads to a startling revelation -- Officer Barbrady can't read! When Barbrady resigns and anarchy ensues, the boys pitch in to help. Cartman brings his own brand of law to the streets of South Park.

4.title: Ike's Wee Wee
4.description: After a mishap in the classroom during his lesson on the evils of drugs and alcohol, Mr. Mackey, the school counselor, is fired. In an act of desperation, he turns to drugs and alcohol. Meanwhile, it's time for Ike's bris and, when Kyle and the boys find out what it means to be circumcised, they try to save Ike from that fate.

5.title: Conjoined Fetus Lady
5.description: With Pip Pirrip as their star player, the South Park dodgeball team is off to the championships. Back in town, local citizens declare a "Conjoined Twin Myslexia Awareness Week" in a misguided attempt to help the school nurse deal with a strange medical disorder.

6.title: The Mexican Staring Frog of Southern Sri Lanka
6.description: The deadly "Mexican Staring Frog of Southern Sri Lanka" is sighted in South Park and the town's fearless hunters, Ned and Jimbo, are on the case. Their heroic efforts drive up the ratings for their hunting show and threaten to edge out Jesus's Jesus and Pals.

7.title: City on the Edge of Forever
7.description: A freak accident leaves the South Park Elementary school bus teetering precariously on the edge of a cliff. As the boys relive landmark moments in their young lives, their bus driver, Ms. Crabtree, goes for help. A strange turn of events leads her to find the love of her life and her dream job as a stand-up comic.

8.title: Summer Sucks
8.description: Summer arrives in South Park, but fireworks have been banned. Mr. Hat has run away and Jimbo and Ned are thrown in prison.

9.title: Chef's Chocolate Salty Balls
9.description: The Sundance Film Festival is moved to town, but it badly affects Mr. Hankey. Meanwhile, Chef tries his luck to make some money, as many visitors come to the town, by selling his new sweet treats, his chocolate salty balls.

10.title: Chickenpox
10.description: The boys' mothers each deliberately try to give them chickenpox from a sleepover at Kenny's, who has chickenpox. They do this to prevent the children from catching it at a later age where it can be worse or even deadly. Upon finding out, the boys plot revenge.

11.title: Roger Ebert Should Lay off the Fatty Foods
11.description: After a trip to the planetarium, the kids become hypnotized. Cartman auditions to sing on the Cheesy Poofs advertisement.

12.title: Clubhouses
12.description: Stan and Kyle build a clubhouse so they can play Truth or Dare with the girls Wendy and Bebe. Cartman and Kenny get together to compete with the two and set about building their own. Randy and Sharon temporarily separate.

13.title: Cow Days
13.description: 'Cow Day' arrives and the boys set their hopes on winning Terrance and Phillip dolls, while Cartman has an unfortunate accident with a bull.

14.title: Chef Aid
14.description: Chef tries to claim that Alanis Morissette plagiarized his song Stinky Britches. However, the record company executive decides to sue him for this.

15.title: Spookyfish
15.description: Aunt Flo comes to stay, but her goldfish she bought for Stan Marsh turns out to be evil. Also 'Cartman' grows a beard and starts acting nice!

16.title: Merry Christmas Charlie Manson
16.description: The boys go to Cartman's grandma's house, Stan having been told by his parents that he cannot go. Meanwhile, Cartman's Uncle Howard and his friend, Charlie Manson, break out of prison.

17.title: Gnomes
17.description: Mr. Garrison's job is in danger, so he assigns the boys to do a report with Tweek. Furthermore, the Tweak's local coffee shop is threatened by big business.

18.title: Prehistoric Ice Man
18.description: Kyle Broflovski falls down a hole while the boys are playing Crocodile Hunter. In the hole Stan Marsh notices a frozen man from 1996, but the boys argue over who found him. The episode mostly parodies the movie Encino Man.

1.title: Rainforest Shmainforest
1.description: The boys are recruited to a rainforest-saving choir by Mr. Mackey after showing poor behavior. Unfortunately for them, the group gets lost in the forest.

2.title: Spontaneous Combustion
2.description: Kenny and many other townsfolk start dying from Spontaneous Combustion. Mayor McDaniels puts Randy Marsh in charge of finding out why people are dying from it.

3.title: The Succubus
3.description: Chef becomes engaged to a seemingly pleasant woman who is not what she seems, while Cartman is having a bad time with the eye doctor.

4.title: Jakovasaurs
4.description: While Stan, Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny are camping in the woods, Cartman discovers a species that was thought to be extinct. This species is very annoying, and everyone in town except Cartman wants to get rid of them.

5.title: Tweek vs. Craig
5.description: Stan, Kyle, and Cartman trick Tweek and Craig into believing that they have been challenged by each other to fight. Mr. Adler, the boys' shop class teacher, can't get over the death of his beloved fiancé.

6.title: Sexual Harassment Panda
6.description: Everyone in South Park is suing everyone else after the school gets a visit from Peetie the Sexual Harassment Panda, having used the message for the wrong reasons.

7.title: Cat Orgy
7.description: Shelly Marsh babysits Cartman while his mom attends a meteor shower party, Shelly's much older boyfriend Skyler and his band visit, and Mr. Kitty is in heat.

8.title: Two Guys Naked In a Hot Tub
8.description: Stan is stuck with the 'Melvins' from school at Mr. Mackey's meteor shower party. Randy and Gerald share an embarrassing intimate moment in a hot tub. The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF) is intent on killing everyone at the party on the basis of presuming it's a cult.

9.title: Jewbilee
9.description: Kyle and Ike attend Jew Scouts and are accompanied by Kenny. Meanwhile, an evil plot to release Haman is at hand.

10.title: Korn's Groovy Pirate Ghost Mystery
10.description: It's Halloween and Stan, Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny dig up Kyle's dead grandma to scare the 5th Graders. Korn comes to town and a mystery involving Pirate Ghosts begins.

11.title: Chinpokomon
11.description: The new fad from Japan, Chinpokomon, has taken over the minds of the third-grade class and the toys are subliminally recruiting children into a plot of bringing down the American government.

12.title: Hooked on Monkey Fonics
12.description: Ms. Cartman buys Cartman a device that could help him win the spelling bee. Kyle falls in love with a home-schooled kid.

13.title: Starvin' Marvin in Space
13.description: Stan, Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny are approached by the CIA about an Ethiopian boy called Starvin' Marvin who has got hold of an alien spacecraft.

14.title: The Red Badge of Gayness
14.description: When Cartman makes a bet with Stan and Kyle that the South does win the American Civil War, he is forced to try and change the re-enactment of the war.

15.title: Mr. Hankey's Christmas Classics
15.description: Hosted by Mr. Hankey himself, holiday songs are performed in unique South Park style. Highlights include Cartman's rendition of 'O Holy Night', Satan's own version of 'Christmas Time in Hell' and a festive duet with Jesus Christ and Santa Claus performing some all-time favorites.

16.title: Are You There God? Its Me, Jesus
16.description: Stan, Kyle, and Kenny become jealous when Cartman finally gets his "period" and Jesus is under pressure as the millennium approaches to do something special.

17.title: World Wide Recorder Concert
17.description: The children of South Park are invited to Arkansas for the 'Four Million Child Blow 2000,' the first worldwide recorder concert.

1.title: The Tooth Fairy Tats 2000
1.description: When Cartman discovers the Tooth Fairy is paying a premium price for his lost teeth, he and the boys seize the opportunity to make some cash. They act as entrepreneurs and build a thriving business by appropriating teeth from the less fortunate. When the boys attempt to expand their racket, they come face-to-face with Denver's mob boss in the black-market tooth trade!

2.title: Cartman's Silly Hate Crime 2000
2.description: Cartman throws a rock at Token after he insults him. Cartman is then suspected of a Hate Crime and is thrown in jail, leaving the boys without their driving force for their sled team.

3.title: Timmy 2000
3.description: When Timmy is diagnosed with Attention Deficit Disorder, it triggers a wave of prescription drug abuse at South Park Elementary. The result is a strangely passive, overly medicated group of children. Meanwhile, Timmy becomes the new lead singer for a garage band called The Lords of the Underworld and propels them to overnight success.

4.title: Quintuplets 2000
4.description: The boys discover a performing group of Quintuplets at a circus and decide to put on their own performance. Meanwhile, the Quintuplets and their grandmother try and escape Romanian Government officials, who want to bring them back to Romania.

5.title: Cartman Joins Nambla
5.description: Cartman, in search of more mature friends, accidentally joins the "North American Man/Boy Love Association", a pedophile group, and puts all the boys of South Park in jeopardy as a result. Meanwhile, Kenny tries to stop his mother and father from having another baby.

6.title: cherokee Hair Tampons
6.description: Kyle needs a kidney transplant and Cartman is discovered to be the perfect donor. Cartman gladly offers his kidney to Kyle, for the price of $10 million. Stan, depressed about the inevitable loss of his best friend decides to take matters into his own hands and get Cartman's kidney for Kyle.

7.title: Chef Goes Nanners
7.description: Chef's passionate protest declaring the South Park flag racist inflames the entire town. The kids separate into two opposing camps and prepare to debate the issue. Stan and Kyle champion the current flag while Wendy and Cartman head up the side for a new flag. Wendy Testaburger finds herself strangely attracted to Cartman.

8.title: Something You can Do with Your Fingers
8.description: The boys form their own boy band, and everyone in town is lining up to audition for a spot as the fifth band member.

9.title: Do The Handicapped Go to Hell?
9.description: The boys become obsessed with religion after a sermon about hell scares them. Meanwhile, Saddam returns to Hell and tries to dispose of Satan's new boyfriend.

10.title: Probably
10.description: Cartman becomes an evangelical preacher when the boys break off from their church. Meanwhile, the feud between Saddam and Chris continues.

11.title: Fourth Grade
11.description: The boys deal with a strict new teacher and experiment with time travel as Mr. Garrison comes to terms with his sexuality.

12.title: Trapper Keeper
12.description: Cartman's new trapper keeper threatens to assimilate the town unless Kyle and a robot from the future can stop it.

13.title: Helen Keller! The Musical
13.description: Cartman goes overboard directing a Thanksgiving production of "The Miracle Worker. Meanwhile, Timmy develops a bond with a runt turkey named Gobbles .

14.title: Pip
14.description: Pip attends boarding school in an adaptation of Great Expectations.

15.title: Fat Camp
15.description: Cartman is outraged when he is sent to fat camp by his mother . Meanwhile, Kenny becomes famous for doing disgusting things for money.

16.title: The Wacky Molestation Adventure
16.description: The boys tell the police that their parents molest them and soon there are no adults left in South Park. However, without authority figures, society crumbles.

17.title: A Very Crappy Christmas
17.description: When everyone in South Park decides to forgo presents and celebrate a non-materialistic holiday season, the boys try to bring the spirit of commercialism back to Christmas by making an animated film.

1.title: It Hits the Fan
1.description: Society is almost destroyed when a popular television show uses the word 'shit' on the air.

2.title: Cripple Fight
2.description: The boys fight to get Big Gay Al reinstated as their scout leader, and Timmy is jealous of the new handicapped kid in town, Jimmy.

3.title: Super Best Friends
3.description: Stan enlists the help of an elite team of religious leaders including Jesus to help him rescue Kyle from a cult.

4.title: Scott Tenorman Must Die
4.description: Cartman plans an elaborate revenge when an older boy named Scott Tenorman cons him out of money.  He then resorts to his deadliest plan yet.

5.title: Terrance and Phillip: Behind the Blow
5.description: The boys attempt to reunite their idols Terrance & Philip after the Canadian duo has a falling out. Meanwhile, South Park falls under the control of environmentalists.

6.title: Cartmanland
6.description: Cartman inherits a large sum of money and uses it to purchase his own amusement park. His resulting success causes Kyle to lose faith in God and getting a hemorrhoid.

7.title: Proper Condom Use
7.description: Improper sex ed classes leads to the boys declaring war on the girls.

8.title: Towelie
8.description: The boys try to rescue their new video game system from the hands of a government agency with the help of a talking towel named Towelie .

9.title: Osama Bin Laden Has Farty Pants
9.description: The boys come face to face with Osama Bin Laden after they are mistakenly shipped to Afghanistan.

10.title: How to Eat with Your Butt
10.description: Cartman puts a picture of Kenny's butt on a milk carton as a prank, but is disturbed when a couple arrives in South Park claiming it was a picture of their missing son.

11.title: The Entity
11.description: Kyle's life takes a turn when his cousin Kyle, a Jewish stereotype, comes to town to visit. Meanwhile, Mr. Garrison comes up with a 'more pleasant' alternative to airline travel.

12.title: Here Comes the Neighborhood
12.description: A class war ensues in South Park when it becomes a hot spot for rich celebrities. Meanwhile, Token feels rejected by his friends and goes to live with lions.

13.title: Kenny Dies
13.description: The boys cope with loss when Kenny is hospitalized with a terminal illness. Cartman attempts to save him by legalizing stem cell research.

14.title: Butters Very Own Episode
14.description: Butters' mother snaps and tries to kill her son after the revelation that her husband frequents gay bathhouses.

1.title: Jared Has Aides
1.description: As the country becomes obsessed with a popular weight loss program, the boys see an opportunity to become sponsored by a major restaurant chain.

2.title: Asspen
characters: Time Share Agents, Phil and Josh
2.description: The kids and their families take a vacation together in Aspen. However, the parents get stuck in an endless timeshare presentation, and Stan is forced into a showdown with a cocky skier.

3.title: Freak Strike
3.description: The boys sign Butters up as a guest on a popular afternoon talk show that features people with weird deformities.

4.title: Fun With Veal
4.description: Stan leads the boys in kidnapping all the baby cows from a local ranch after a first hand look at how veal is made turns him into a vegetarian.

5.title: The New Terrance and Phillip Movie Trailer
5.description: The boys have to sit through an episode of Fightin' Round The World with Russell Crowe so they can see a preview for the new movie starring Terrance and Phillip. However, bad luck forces them to race across town searching for a working TV.

6.title: Professor Chaos
6.description: After being shunned by his friends, Butters develops a villainous alter ego and sets out to wreak havoc on the town. Meanwhile, the boys search for a new friend.

7.title: The Simpsons Already Did It
7.description: Professor Chaos struggles to find an evil scheme that hasn't already been done on The Simpsons. Meanwhile, Cartman accidentally creates life in his aquarium.

8.title: Red Hot Catholic Love
8.description: Father Maxi travels to the Vatican to confront the growing problem of priests molesting children. Meanwhile, Cartman discovers that it is possible to crap out of your mouth.

9.title: Free Hat
9.description: The boys start a group to stop a maniacal Steven Spielberg from altering 'Raiders of the Lost Ark' while also catering to a group who demand a trailer-trash toddler murderer be freed.

10.title: Bebe's Boobs Destroy Society
10.description: Bebe Stevens's breasts begin to develop and the boys are at a loss to explain why they are suddenly drawn to her, when they had no interest in her before.

11.title: Child Abduction is Not Funny
11.description: Parents in South Park become gripped with fear that their children will be abducted, which leads to them taking more and more extreme measures to ensure their safety, finally culminating in a giant wall being built around the town.

12.title: Child Abduction is Not Funny
12.description: The boys try to build a ladder to heaven to retrieve a winning ticket Kenny had before he died. When their efforts are mistaken for an act of childhood innocence, a media circus ensues.

13.title: The Return of the Fellowship of the Ring to the Two Towers
13.description: The boys are on a mission: return 'The Lord of the Rings' to the Two Towers Video Store in Conifer. But this is no ordinary copy. Butters, the evil sixth graders , and the boys' parents all try to steal the tape from the boys

14.title: The Death Camp of Tolerance
14.description: Mr. Garrison does what he can to get fired for being gay so he can sue the school for millions of dollars. This turns out to be easier said than done because the parents and school staff feel they have to be tolerant no matter what.

15.title: The Biggest Douche in the Universe
15.description: Chef's parents try to expel Kenny's spirit from Cartman. Stan is at odds with psychic John Edward.

16.title: My Future Self n' Me
16.description: When a 32-year-old man claiming to be Stan from the future shows up in South Park, young Stan is forced to come to terms with the loser he will become. Meanwhile, South Park's own little entrepreneur, Eric Cartman, is at the helm of a new money-making venture. Cartman is in the business of revenge.

17.title: Red Sleigh Down
17.description: Cartman has to score one big 'nice' on Santa's list to be eligible for Christmas presents this year. He recruits Santa, Mr. Hankey, and Jesus in a desperate attempt to bring Christmas to the downtrodden citizens of Iraq.

1.title: Cancelled
1.description: An alien satellite dish is placed in Cartman's butt. Shortly after, the boys are abducted by the aliens that installed it. They find out that the planet Earth is simply an intergalactic reality show. When word gets back to their home planet, the aliens decide to cancel the show. Something must be done.

2.title: Krazy Kripples
2.description: Timmy and Jimmy start a club for cripples. Meanwhile, Christopher Reeve comes to town to promote stem cell research.

3.title: Toilet Paper
3.description: Cartman convinces the boys to toilet paper their art teacher's house as revenge for keeping them after school. After the fact, Kyle is overwhelmed with guilt and on the verge of confessing his part in the prank. Officer Barbrady is hot on the perpetrators' trail, while Cartman contemplates killing Kyle so he doesn't rat them out.

4.title: I'm a Little Bit Country
4.description: The boys join some anti-war protesters because it's a free pass out of school for the day. Their simple plan to protest their way out of class goes south when they find themselves in the middle of the two opposing sides of the issue. Meanwhile, Cartman attempts a flashback to 1776 to avoid studying for his American History assignment.

5.title: Fat Butt and Pancake Head
5.description: Jennifer Lopez is enraged to learn that a new "diva" has stolen her record deal and her boyfriend. South Park will never be the same after Jennifer & Ben Affleck come to town.

6.title: Lil Crime Stoppers
6.description: The boys start their very own South Park detective agency. After they return a missing doll to a little girl, the police department recognizes the boys' efforts and officially names them, 'junior deputies.' Their next assignment - to break up a meth lab.

7.title: Red Man's Greed
7.description: The owners of the Three Feathers Indian Casino have acquired the town of South Park. The citizens are being forced off their land to make way for a new super highway. Faced with saying goodbye to their friends and their way of life, the boys rally the townspeople to fight back against the rich and powerful Indians.

8.title: South Park is Gay!
8.description: The town of South Park celebrates the new, hip metro-sexual craze. Cartman, Stan, and Kenny are super hot to be gay. Kyle is cut from the group because he doesn't "feel" metro-sexual and Mr. Garrison accuses the guys from "Queer Eye" of selling out.

9.title: Christian Rock Hard
9.description: When the other boys kick Cartman out of their band, he pulls his own group together to make music for Jesus. While Cartman's "Faith + 1" rockets to the top of the Christian charts, Stan, Kyle and Kenny are arrested for downloading music from the Internet.

10.title: Grey Dawn
10.description: After South Park's senior citizens have mowed down more than a few farmers' markets, the residents no longer feel it's safe to be out in the streets. With their well being at stake, the boys decide to take action against the older generation. Unwilling to surrender their driver's licenses, the elderly fight back.

11.title: Casa Bonita
11.description: Kyle's parents are taking him and 3 of his friends to Casa Bonita, Colorado's version of a Mexican Disneyland. When Kyle chooses to invite Butters instead of Cartman, the fat boy plots to do away with Butters and keep Casa Bonita to himself.

12.title: All About Mormons
12.description: When a super nice Mormon family moves to South Park, naturally the boys' first instinct is to kick the new kid's ass. But when Stan and his dad become intrigued with the Harrison's overwhelming happiness and the story of Joseph Smith, the Marsh family decides to convert to Mormonism. The conversion, however, doesn't quite take.

13.title: Butt Out
13.description: Representatives from the anti-smoking campaign rap about the dangers of smoking for the children of South Park. For fear of growing up to be giant nerds, the boys decide to take up the nasty habit.

14.title: Raisins
14.description: Wendy breaks up with Stan, so the rest of the boys take him to Raisins. Butters falls in love with one of the waitresses.

15.title: It's Christmas in Canada
15.description: The Broflovski family is dealt a devastating blow when Ike's Canadian birth parents show up unexpectedly, and want their baby back. When the townspeople decide to forego Christmas gifts and take up a collection to get Ike home to South Park, the boys are distraught. Before all the money for their Christmas presents gets spent, they hightail it to Canada to bring Ike home themselves.

1.title: Good Times with Weapons
1.description: The boys are transformed into Japanese warriors after they buy martial arts weapons at a local market. Their sworn enemy, Professor Chaos, confronts them and a highly stylized battle ensues.

2.title: Up the Down Steroid
2.description: Jimmy is in training for the upcoming Special Olympics and he is determined to win at any cost. Meanwhile, Cartman decides that he can easily take first place if he can convince the qualifying committee that he is handicapped.

3.title: The Passion of the Jew
3.description: Kyle finally sees the blockbuster movie "The Passion of the Christ" and admits that Cartman has been right about the Jewish people all along. After Stan and Kenny see the film, they angrily pursue Mel Gibson to get their money back.

4.title: You Got F'd in the A
4.description: Stan has been challenged to a dance-off and it's up to him to put together a team of South Park's best dancers to compete against a troupe from Orange County. While Butters has won awards for his dancing, he refuses to help Stan. He hasn't been able to dance since the tragic death of eleven audience members at his last competition.

5.title: AWESOM-O
5.description: Cartman dresses up like a robot named A.W.E.S.O.M.-O 4000 and moves in with Butters. His plan is to learn all of Butters' innermost secrets and then use them against him. While Butters is thrilled to have found a new best friend, the U.S. Army believes AWESOM-O is a new secret weapon and Hollywood is after the phony robot to develop their next big blockbuster.

6.title: The Jeffersons
6.description: Michael Jackson, under the fake name of Martin Jefferson, moves to South Park where he gets a little too close to the boys.

7.title: Goobacks
7.description: Humans from the year 3045 are traveling to South Park through a recently discovered time portal and are looking for work. When the boys try to earn some extra money, the time-traveling immigrants are willing to do the same work for next to nothing, causing the boys to lose their jobs.

8.title: Douche and Turd
8.description: PETA demonstrates against the use of a cow as South Park Elementary's mascot so the student body is forced to choose a new one. As the election approaches, Kyle tries to convince everyone that his candidate, a giant douche, is better than Cartman's nominee, a turd sandwich.

9.title: Something Wall-Mart This Way Comes
9.description: In order to save South Park, Stan and Kyle have to find a way to destroy the ever-expanding Wall-Mart superstore while keeping Cartman from stabbing them in the back.

10.title: Pre-School
10.description: For five long years, Stan, Kyle, Kenny, Cartman, and Butters have kept a secret about an illegal incident that happened back in pre-school. Now, the kid who took the fall for the boys is getting out of Juvie and his first order of business is vowing revenge on the boys.

11.title: Quest for Ratings
11.description: The boys produce their own morning news show on the school's closed-circuit television station and are immediately caught up in an intense competition for ratings.

12.title: Stupid Spoiled Whore Video Playset
12.description: The fourth grade girls idolize the rich, famous, spoiled socialite, Paris Hilton. Many of them owning Hilton's brand new toy set that comes complete with video camera, night vision filter, play money, 16 hits of ecstasy and a losable cell phone. Disturbed by the corruptive influence the trashy celebrity has on young girls in South Park, one of the town's citizens challenges her to a "whore-off."

13.title: Cartman's Incredible Gift
13.description: After sustaining a severe head injury, Cartman appears to have the power to see into the future. Park County detectives are quick to enlist his help in cracking unsolved murder cases and Cartman is more than willing to help... for a price. In the meantime, a group of "licensed" psychics cry foul when Cartman refuses to join their ranks.

14.title: Woodland Critter Christmas
14.description: Stan gets tricked by a group of satanic woodland creatures into killing a mountain lion to allow them a safe summoning of the Anti-Christ.

1.title: Mr. Garrison's Fancy New Vagina
1.description: Mr. Garrison gets what he has always wanted - a sex change. Meanwhile, Kyle learns that Jews can't play basketball And as a result wants to become tall and black.

2.title: Die Hippie, Die
2.description: When hippie drum circles start popping up in people's attics and backyards the citizens of South Park have no choice but to turn to Eric Cartman for help.

3.title: Wing
3.description: The boys start a talent agency in hopes of making money from Token's singing talent.

4.title: Best Friends Forever
4.description: Kenny is deliberately killed by heaven's occupants after becoming master of the PSP in order for him to save them. However, the town brings him back to life, leaving him in a persistent vegetative state.

5.title: The Losing Edge
5.description: The boys try to lose their baseball games on purpose so they can play all summer, instead of dealing with baseball. Randy trains to fight the other fathers at the games.

6.title: The Death of Eric Cartman
6.description: Stan, Kyle and Kenny (along with the rest of the 4th Grade) have had enough of Cartman and ignore him, which leads him to think he has died and has become a ghost. Cartman tries to get into heaven by doing "good deeds", but fails in the end.

7.title: Erection Day
7.description: Jimmy starts unintentionally 'pitching a tent'. The boys consider entering the talent show to try to win the prize of a $100 South Park Mall gift certificate.

8.title: Two Days Before The Day After Tommorow
8.description: A State of Emergency is declared in South Park as Stan and Cartman break the world's largest beaver dam and flood the adjacent town of Beaverton, causing fear of Global Warming.

9.title: Marjorine
9.description: Butters must fake his death, dress up as a girl and infiltrate Heidi Turner's slumber party, in order to retrieve a "future telling device" that Cartman and the other boys are convinced is real.

10.title: Follow That Egg!
10.description: After learning that Mr. Slave is engaged to Big Gay Al, Mrs. Garrison vows to ban same-sex marriage. Garrison starts a school project involving eggs to "prove" that same sex marriages are 'wrong'. He pairs Stan Marsh and Kyle Broflovski away from each other at first, turning them into rivals.

11.title: Ginger Kids
11.description: Cartman suffers from a mysterious and sudden onset of Gingervitus. Sick and tired of being ridiculed for his red hair, light skin and freckles, he rallies all the ginger kids everywhere to fight against discrimination and rise up and become the master race they are intended to be.

12.title: Trapped in the Closet
12.description: Stan takes a Scientology personality quiz, and after making several allegations, the Scientologists try to convince him he is to be their new leader. Tom Cruise goes into Stan's closet and refuses to come out, and even denies the fact that he's in the closet. Meanwhile, Stan's involvement in Scientology puts a strain on his friendship with Kyle.

13.title: Free Willzyx
13.description: The boys try to rescue their new friend Willzyx, a talking space whale, from the Denver Sea Park and with the help of MASA (Mexican Aeronautica y Spacia Administracion) get him home to the moon for $200.

14.title: Bloody Mary
14.description: Stan is embarrassed when his dad gets pulled over for drunk driving. Randy believes that only one thing can save him from his "disease" - a bleeding statue of the Virgin Mary in the next town.

1.title: The Return of Chef
1.description: Chef returns after his stay with the Super Adventure Club. Stan, Kyle, Cartman, and Kenny notice there's something different about him.

2.title: Smug Alert
2.description: Gerald buys a hybrid car, which causes problems for Kyle when they move to San Francisco.

3.title: Cartoon Wars Part I
3.description: The boys seem to have a typically pleasant night, when all of a sudden, a panic ensues.  Family Guy proposes to show the image of Muhammad. As terrorists threaten America, Cartman and Kyle investigate this fiasco of hardship and do what any kid would do: they go looking for trouble.  During their quest for FOX Studios, Cartman tries to get the episode pulled.

4.title: Cartoon Wars Part II
4.description: After leaving Kyle injured on the side of the road, Cartman races to FOX Studios determined to put an end to Family Guy once and for all.

5.title: A Million Little Fibers
5.description: Towelie is broke and needs money to pay the rent. Could writing his memoirs be the solution to his debt?

6.title: ManBearPig
6.description: The boys end up helping Al Gore rid the world of "ManBearPig," only to find themselves abandoned by this less-than-average politician.

7.title: Tsst
7.description: When Cartman's mom realizes she can't control her son anymore, she enlists help from an expert. The "Dog Whisperer" may have what it takes, but Eric Cartman's not going down without a fight.

8.title: Make Love, Not WarCraft
8.description: There's trouble in the online gaming world when a mad gamer won't play by the rules. The boys dedicate their lives to defeating the renegade and saving the World of Warcraft.

9.title: Mystery of the Urinal Deuce
9.description: Mr. Mackey is determined to find out who took a crap in the urinal, while Cartman manages to link it to 9/11, causing Stan and Kyle to find the truth behind this terrible event in history.

10.title: Miss Teacher Bangs a boy
10.description: Cartman is appointed to the post of school hallway monitor at South Park Elementary. In his new role, Cartman takes it personally when an infraction is committed in his jurisdiction. When Kyle discovers that a teacher is having sex with Ike, he and Cartman team up to put a stop to the inappropriate behavior.

11.title: Hell on Earth 2006
11.description: Satan is throwing the biggest Halloween costume party ever and no one will be admitted without a wristband. Satan is busy checking the R.S.V.P. list and deciding what costume to wear to the big event. Every detail must be perfect for the prince of darkness. But even Satan can't foresee everything. Meanwhile, Butters summons Biggie Smalls.

12.title: Go God Go
12.description: Cartman decides to freeze himself so he doesn't have to wait for the Nintendo Wii to come out. Ms. Garrison is forced to teach evolution to her students.

13.title: Go God Go XII
13.description: Impatient for the impending release of the Nintendo Wii, Cartman freezes himself so the time will elapse faster. He is later unfrozen five hundred years in the future.

14.title: Stanley's Cup
14.description: When Stan's bike is towed, he can't do his job as a paperboy. The only way of getting his bike back is to coach a pee-wee hockey team.

1.title: With Apologies to Jesse Jackson
1.description: Randy accidentally offends black people on Wheel of Fortune by guessing the word N***** instead of "Naggers", causing trouble for his son at school, while Cartman gets caught up in a fight with a little person that visits his school.

2.title: Cartman Sucks
2.description: Cartman's latest trick results in him obsessing over a missing photo and gets Butters sent to a special camp where they attempt to pray away bisexuality

3.title: Lice Capades
3.description:
The fourth grade class won’t be denied their rights as children to make fun of the unfortunate kid who has lice.

Confidentiality about who has head lice must be maintained so no child is embarrassed; so says the administration at South Park Elementary. When Garrison refuses to name names, Eric Cartman finds a way to detect who has the head cooties.

At the same time, a lice population faces an immediate threat coming from the outside world.

4.title: The Snuke
4.description: Cartman suspects the new Muslim Student to be a terrorist who is planning to strike at the Hillary Clinton campaign rally. Meanwhile, the real terrorists plan to attack the campaign rally.

5.title: Fantastic Easter Special
5.description: Stan, confused about what painting Eggs and Rabbits have to do with Easter, gets himself into more trouble than he bargained for when he finds out the answer.

6.title: D-Yikes!
6.description: Ms. Garrison gets dumped again, after complaining about men she is told about lesbianism. Unfortunately, the lesbian bar Les Bos has been bought by Persians.

7.title: Night of the Living Homeless
7.description: An increasing amount of homeless people in South Park worries its residents, and the boys decide to solve the problem on their own.

8.title: Le Petit Tourette
8.description: Cartman discovers the joys of having Tourette's syndrome, and Kyle tries to stop his evil plan.

9.title: More Crap
9.description: Randy's excessive consumption of P.F. Chang's produces constipation that creates a world record sized crap, until Bono makes a bigger one.

10.title: Imaginationland
10.description: When the entire contents of the world's imagination lay open before them, Stan and Kyle step right in. Back in South Park, Cartman swears he's seen a leprechaun.

11.title: Imaginationland II
11.description: Stan and Kyle are being held in the bowels of the Pentagon until they tell the government how they got into Imaginationland. Meanwhile, Cartman simply won't rest until he finds Kyle and gets him to make good on their bet to suck his balls.

12.title: Imaginationland III
12.description: Inside Imaginationland, Stan and Butters engage in the battle of their lives as they fight the army of evil imaginary forces. Meanwhile, Cartman goes all the way to the Supreme Court to get Kyle to pay up on their bet.

13.title: Guitar Queer-O
13.description: Stan and Kyle are hooked on Guitar Hero. But Stan's superior skills on the video game damages his friendship with Kyle.

14.title: The List
14.description: The fourth grade girls have made a secret list that rates every boy's looks from cutest to ugliest. When the boys steal the list, they are completely unprepared to deal with the results.

1.title: Tonsil Trouble
1.description: Cartman finds himself fighting for his life after a routine tonsillectomy goes wrong. When Kyle becomes infected with Cartman's ailment, the two won't stop for anything as they search for a cure that will reverse their otherwise certain mortality.

2.title: Britney's New Look
2.description: When the boys help Britney Spears get to the North Pole, they discover the shocking secret behind her popularity.

3.title: Major Boobage
3.description: Kenny becomes addicted to the newest method of getting high: snorting a defensive foul liquid sprayed by male cats. After a new law banning cats is consequently passed, Cartman becomes determined to save Mr. Kitty from being taken away

4.title: Canada On Strike
4.description: After being mocked, Canada goes on strike. It is up to the boys to talk them down.

5.title: Eek, A Penis!
5.description: While Ms. Garrison is off trying to find a way to become the man he was always intended to be, Cartman is put in charge of the classroom.

6.title: Over Logging
6.description: One day the citizens of South Park wake up to find the internet is gone. When Randy hears there may still be some internet out in California, he packs up his family and heads west.

7.title: Super Fun Time
7.description: While the kids are on an educational field trip to a living museum, Cartman makes Butters sneak away from the class to go to the amusement center located next door.

8.title: The China Problem
8.description: After watching the intimidating opening ceremonies of the recent Olympic games, Cartman understands that the Chinese are only just days away from invading his homeland. While the rest of the American people are haunted by the memory of a recent tragic event, only Butters will stand with Cartman as he confronts the Chinese.

9.title: Breast Cancer Show Ever
9.description: Wendy gets in trouble when she threatens to beat up Cartman after school.

10.title: Pandemic
10.description: Following a money-making trend of Peruvian flute bands, the boys team up with Craig to form a Peruvian flute band to make easy money, however things don't go as planned. Meanwhile Randy is obsessed with the new video camera he just bought

11.title: Pandemic 2: The Startling
11.description: The boys are lost in the Andes where they discover the startling secret behind the attack of the giant guinea pigs. The boys now have the power to rescue their town and the rest of the world from the onslaught, but the Head of Homeland Security stands firmly in their way. Meanwhile, Randy bravely documents the destruction while trying to save his family.

12.title: About Last Night...
12.description: While the country celebrates, the President-elect catches everyone off guard when he arrives at the White House prematurely. From the Oval Office, the new Commander-In-Chief assembles his team and prepares for the job ahead

13.title: Elementary School Musical
13.description: The boys must embrace the latest fad to hit South Park Elementary or risk their status as the coolest kids in school.

14.title: The Ungroundable
14.description: Butters is sure he’s seen a Vampire at school but he can’t get anyone to listen to him. Tired of being teased at school and punished by his parents, Butters joins the Vampire group and becomes "ungroundable." Meanwhile, the Goth Kids are angry and frustrated when the other kids can’t tell the difference between a Goth and a Vampire.

1.title: The Ring
1.description: Kenny takes his new girlfriend Tammy to a Jonas Brothers' concert where they each get purity rings.

2.title: The Coon
2.description: "The Coon" rises from the trash and takes his place as a lone vigilante who wipes out crime in the town of South Park. A rival superhero appears on the scene in the form of "Mysterion" and challenges the Coon's place as a "symbol" for the town.

3.title: MargaritaVille
3.description: Randy steps forward with a solution to fix the desperate financial state everyone finds themselves in. The town gets behind him and everyone starts to live a life that no longer depends on any economy at all. Meanwhile, an unlikely savior makes the ultimate sacrifice to solve everyone's problems.

4.title: Eat, Pray, Queef
4.description: Someone played an April Fools joke on the boys and it didn’t go over well. Butters is incapacitated, Cartman is furious and the rest of the boys are afraid someone might do it again.

5.title: Fishsticks
5.description: Jimmy Valmer solely creates the funniest joke in the world, yet Eric Cartman takes half the credit for it. Meanwhile, rapper Kanye West fails to understand the joke, and resents it being directed at him.

6.title: Pinewood Derby
6.description: Randy has a plan to ensure that Stan wins a first-place trophy in this year's Pinewood Derby.

7.title: Fatbeard
7.description: Cartman recruits a small "crew" that includes Butters to aid in his dream of living on Skull Island where they will frolic in crystal clear waterfalls and discover buried treasure. Cartman promises that paradise awaits if they can just get to Somalia.

8.title: Dead Celebrities
8.description: Ike Broflovski is being tormented by paranormal forces. Kyle brings in professional ghost hunters to help save his little brother.

9.title: Butters Bottom Bitch
9.description: Butters has made it all the way to the 4th grade without ever kissing a girl. All of his friends have been teasing him mercilessly. Butters is determined to catch up with the rest of the boys in his class. Meanwhile, one overly dedicated cop wages war on prostitution in South Park.

10.title: W.T.F
10.description: After attending a WWE event, The Boys all want to be professional wrestlers. have found their new calling in life and they hurry to sign up for the wrestling club. They soon find out the kind of wrestling they teach at school is not the same thing they saw at the WWE show. The boys' wrestling coach has the same problem. He's been struggling for years to get people to see the difference.

11.title: Whale Whores
11.description: The Japanese are on a crazed hunt to kill all the dolphins and whales in the world. Stan Marsh and his family are spending his birthday at the Denver Aquarium where they will get to swim with the dolphins. But things turn bloody when the Japanese people attack, kill all the dolphins and ruin Stan’s big day. There seems to be no end to the senseless killing. Stan takes on the cause to save the dolphins from the Japanese.

12.title: The F Word
12.description: South Park is experiencing an increased number of Harley Riders in their town, deciding that these visitors are the true meaning of the word "fag".

13.title: Dances With Smurfs
13.description: Eric Cartman seizes the opportunity to become the voice of change at the school when he takes over the morning announcements. His target is South Park Elementary's Student Body President, Wendy Testaburger. Cartman is asking the tough questions and gains followers.

14.title: Pee
14.description: Things at the water park are not what they seem. The boys' fun-filled day is about to turn deadly. Events are in play at Splash Town that signal the end of the world is upon us. Cartman tries to warn everyone but no one will listen. Disaster is about to strike and the boys are in a race to survive.

1.title: Sexual Healing
1.description: Rich, successful men suddenly want to have sex with many, many women, and the nation's top scientists are called in to put a stop to the epidemic. After extensive testing, some of the boys in South Park Elementary are diagnosed as sex addicts. The search for a cure to the outbreak of sexual addiction leads them all the way to Independence Hall.

2.title: The Tale of Scrotie McBoogerballs
2.description: The boys are given The Catcher in the Rye to read in school with warnings of vulgar scenes and foul language. Dissatisfied that the book is relatively tame, they are inspired to write a book of their own that contains true vulgarity. When the boys discover that Stan's mom has found their masterpiece, they blame its writing on Butters, who in turn becomes a famous celebrity for "his" amazing book. When Butters refuses to admit that the boys wrote the book, they seek revenge.

3.title: Medicinal Fried Chicken
3.description: Cartman's favorite restaurant, Kentucky Fried Chicken, has been shut down and replaced by a store that sells medical marijuana to cancer patients. Cartman will do anything to get his beloved fried chicken back. Meanwhile, Randy gives himself testicular cancer so he can get a prescription card to buy pot.

4.title: You Have 0 Friends
4.description: Kyle adds Kip Drordy as a "friend" on Facebook, due to Kip being the only person in South Park to not have any friends. This causes all of his old friends to desert him. Kyle's situation is so desperate, he seeks help from Cartman. Meanwhile, Stan literally gets sucked into Facebook after attempting to delete his account with 845,000 "friends".

5.description: While on a school field trip, Stan Marsh accidentally insults Tom Cruise again, which sets off a chain reaction of enraged celebrities. As a result, the two-hundred previously ridiculed celebrities file a class action lawsuit against the town of South Park. It is up to Stan to develop a plan to sort out this predicament and save the town.

6.description: Angry celebrities and violent ginger kids are after the "goo" of M********** in order to become immune to slander. To add to the mess, the celebrities activate Mecha-Streisand and threaten to destroy South Park. Despite this, the mystery of “Who is Eric Cartman’s father?” obsesses Cartman.

7.title: Crippled Summer
7.description: Competition is the name of the game this summer. There is no time for Jimmy and his friends to slack off. They're working to be this year's champions at summer camp. Jimmy suits up and prepares to shred in the annual surfing contest.

8.title: Poor and Stupid
8.description: Cartman wants to race with the pros and he's ready to do whatever it takes to make it happen. He's afraid that no matter how hard he tries, he'll never reach the level of the other NASCAR drivers. Working with Butters as his pit crew chief, Cartman pulls out all the stops to compete in the race of his life - but Kenny will put his own life on the line to stop him from ruining NASCAR's reputation.

9.title: Its a Jersey Thing
9.description: New Jersey is rapidly taking over the nation one state at a time and their next stop is South Park. As the Jerseyites spill into Colorado and approach South Park, Randy and the boys stand strong against the onslaught.

10.title: Insheeption
10.description: When he's sent to the school counselor to talk about his compulsive hoarding, Stan realizes that he's not the only one who has a problem. When Mr. Mackey and Stan agree to surrender themselves to the hoarding experts, Stan gets more than a glimpse of what it was like for Mr. Mackey in the 4th grade at South Park Elementary.

11.title: Coon 2: Hindsight
11.description: This episode is the first of a three-part arc, followed by "Mysterion Rises". The Coon now leads an entire team of crime-fighters, named "Coon and Friends". They are ready to take their place, among the world's most admired and beloved superheroes. But much to the Coon's dismay, someone else keeps beating them to the punch. The nation looks to another hero to get them through the BP disaster and dissension develops within the ranks of Coon and Friends.

12.title: Mysterion Rises
12.description: This episode is the second of a three-part arc that began with the episode "Coon 2: Hindsight". Led by Mysterion, Coon and Friends are working together to help the people in the Gulf of Mexico, who are at the mercy of the dark lord Cthulhu. The Coon, scorned by his fellow super heroes and now working alone, is out for revenge.

13.title: Coon Vs. Coon & Friends
13.description: This episode is the third and final part of the three-part story arc that started with "Coon 2: Hindsight" and continued with "Mysterion Rises". Coon and Friends find themselves at the mercy of Cartman who now has the dark lord Cthulhu doing his bidding. Kenny wrestles with the curse of his super power through his alter ego, Mysterion.

14.title: Creme Fraiche
14.description: Stan's life is in shambles both at home and in school; Randy's obsession with the Food Network is changing everything. It even forces Sharon to explore a new interest of her own.

1.title: HUMANCENTiPAD
1.description: Kyle is intimately involved in the development of a revolutionary new product that is about to be launched by Apple. Meanwhile, Cartman who doesn't even have an iPad yet blames his mother.

2.title: Funnybot
2.description: During South Park Elementary's first annual "Comedy Awards", Jimmy says that Germans are the least funny people in the world. The Germans are highly insulted. They vow that retaliation toward the kids at the school will be swift and brutal.

3.title: Royal Pudding
3.description: It is a joyous time for all Canadians as the royal wedding commences. But just as the Prince and Princess are about to be joined for all eternity, the princess is abducted! All Canadians are called upon to help save the princess. Ike answers the call to arms.

4.title: T.M.I
4.description: Cartman is sent to anger management classes after posting the penis sizes of every boy in the fourth grade.

5.title: Crack Baby Athletic Association
5.description: Cartman has a new protégé. He's found someone who is smart, ambitious, and willing to look the other way in order to get to the top. Kyle is brought in on the ground floor of Cartman's latest business venture, the Crack Baby Athletic Association.

6.title: City Sushi
6.description: Butters is taken to a psychiatrist who claims that he has Multiple Personality Disorder, which requires medication to treat. Meanwhile, a new restaurant opens next to South Park's City Wok.

7.title: You're Getting Old
7.description: After Stan celebrates his 10th birthday, he begins to see everything differently. The other boys think he's become a major buzzkill and start to avoid hanging out with him. When Stan and Kyle have a major blow up, the very fabric of South Park begins to unravel.

8.title: Ass Burgers
8.description: Cartman tries to give himself Asperger's Syndrome in an odd way. Meanwhile, Stan can't seem to get his life back to normal no matter what he tries. Will anything ever be the same in South Park again?

9.title: The Last of the Meheecans
9.description: A game between the boys turns serious when Cartman joins the U.S. Border Patrol. Not surprisingly, Cartman turns out to be really good at stopping Mexicans.

10.title: Bass to Mouth
10.description: The students of South Park Elementary are the victims of a new gossip website. An elusive hacker has somehow gained access into the student's confidential phone calls and e-mails and is posting all their juicy stories. The boys and their friends are shocked when they discover the identity of the hacker.

11.title: Broadway Bro Down
11.description: Sharon is thrilled that Randy is making an effort to do more things that she enjoys. But, after he takes her to see a hit musical in Denver, Randy becomes Broadway’s biggest fan. Randy whisks Sharon away to New York and treats her to every musical on the Great White Way.

12.description: The kids at South Park Elementary are being punished for Cartman's failings in the physical education department. What will Cartman do when they all gang up on him?

13.title: A History Channel Thanksgiving
13.description: After watching a Thanksgiving special on The History Channel, the boys believe that aliens were involved in the original feast. But, questions remain... was the first Thanksgiving haunted? Is alien technology responsible for stuffing? The truth could change Thanksgiving for everyone.

14.title: The Poor Kid
14.description: With their parents in jail, Kenny McCormick, his brother, and sister find themselves in the foster care system. Eric realizes he is the poorest kid in school in Kenny's absence, and so Mysterion must find a way to save them all!

1.title: Reverse Cowgirl
1.description: One of the boys is the subject of ridicule by his friends when his mother publicly scolds him for leaving the toilet seat up, but he doesn't listen. As a result of his actions, a death shakes South Park and TSA employees are hired to impose strict restroom security rules.

2.title: Cash For Gold
2.description: Cartman launches an gemstones network show and in turn creates a very lucrative business. Stan searches for the real value of a piece of jewelry that was a gift from his grandfather. Meanwhile, Cartman's lucrative new business preys upon an extremely vulnerable clientele.

3.title: Faith Hilling
3.description: Mankind's evolution begins to accelerate at a rapid and disturbing pace. Concurrently, another species on the planet is exhibiting the same drastic development. Eventually the two species will battle to the death and Faith Hilling may be humanity's only hope.

4.title: Jewpacabra
4.description: South Park's big Easter egg hunt is in jeopardy when there are rumors of a dangerous beast lurking in the woods nearby. Cartman tries to warn everyone that their lives are at risk if they participate in the egg hunt. No one believes him until he produces video evidence of the mysterious being.

5.title: Butterballs
5.description: Stan wants to raise awareness about the dangers of bullying by shooting a big dance video. Meanwhile, Butters is the victim of an unlikely bully.

6.title: I Should Have Never Gone Ziplining
6.description: The boys are excited to spend a day ziplining in the Colorado Mountains. But high in the Rockies, far from their families, their trip takes a bad turn. Chances of survival are slim. All they can do is wait to be rescued. But will help come too late?

7.title: Cartman Finds Love
7.description: There's a new girl in school and everyone wants to know who she has a crush on. Cartman is especially excited. He's discovered something inside himself that he never knew he had. Now, to make sure nobody gets in the way of true love, it's time for Cartman to finally let someone know exactly how he feels.

8.title: Sarcastaball
8.description: As a concerned parent, Randy radically changes the way football is played at South Park Elementary. The new version of the game quickly becomes the nation’s most popular sport. One gifted student emerges as a star athlete in Sarcastaball.

9.title: Raising The Bar
9.description: Cartman owns up to being fat and decides that driving around on a scooter is his right. Kyle sees that Cartman isn’t the only one who finds no shame in his unhealthy lifestyle. Meanwhile, Cartman discovers he has a rival in America’s Sweetheart, Honey Boo Boo.

10.title: Insecurity
10.description: The man who visits all the homes in South Park every day is now under suspicion. The luxury of having packages delivered to your doorstep is suddenly a threat to every family in the neighborhood. Cartman takes matters into his own hands and signs up for a home security system.

11.title: Going Native
11.description: Butters' outrageous behavior is a sign. It's time for him to begin a journey where he will follow in the path of his ancestors. When Butters starts acting out at school, his parents realize it's time to tell him why he's not like all of the other kids. He must travel to a foreign place to learn the ways of his people. It will be a difficult trip for a young boy to make alone so Butters chooses Kenny to travel with him to the distant and secluded island of Hawaii.

12.title: A Nightmare on Face Time
12.description: The boys are all ready to dress up as their favorite foursome, the Avengers, for Halloween. After months of planning their costumes, at the last minute Randy tells Stan he can’t go trick or treating with his friends. Instead, Stan has to pitch in and help his father with a new business venture.

13.title: A Scause For Applause
13.description: Rocked by the recent news of drug use by a beloved icon, the world is left feeling lost and betrayed. The boys, join with the rest of the nation, and remove their yellow wristbands. Everyone is on board, except for Stan, who just can’t seem to cut off his bracelet.

14.title: Obama Wins
14.description: Eric Cartman is hiding something in his bedroom that could change the entire outcome of the Presidential election.

1.title: Let Go, Let Gov
1.description: When Cartman manages to get himself behind the doors of the NSA, he doesn’t like what he finds in his personal file. He thinks it’s time he told everyone the truth. Meanwhile, Butters finds someone new to listen to his prayers.

2.title: Informative Murder Porn
2.description: The boys use the game of Minecraft as a distraction to keep their parents from hurting each other.

3.title: World War Zimmerman
3.description: Cartman is deeply disturbed by a single person who he sees as a threat to all humanity. He races around the country to put an end to Patient Zero, the ticking time bomb that is Token.

4.title: Goth Kids 3: Dawn of the Posers
4.description: One of the Goth kids has been sent to a camp for troubled children. When she returns, her friends find her changed in a disturbing way. With their very existence threatened, the Goths have to do something drastic. They are forced to ask the Vamp kids for help.

5.title: Taming Strange
5.description: Ike just isn’t himself lately and he and Kyle are growing apart. Kyle goes to the guidance counselor for advice but Mr. Mackey is too busy dealing with the bugs in the school’s new integrated technology system to help. Kyle decides to take Ike to a live performance of his favorite show; Yo Gabba Gabba. He hopes it'll make his little brother like him again.

6.title: Ginger Cow
6.description: Religious leaders descend upon South Park to witness a Biblical prophecy that has been fulfilled. Cartman and Kyle are the only two at odds as the world embarks upon a thousand years of peace and harmony.

7.title: Black Friday
7.description: Anticipation for the biggest shopping day of the year is building. The dark days of winter are coming and that can only mean one thing: the fight to be the first in the mall on Black Friday has begun. The boys prepare to battle the crowds the day after Thanksgiving to get the best deal on the new gaming systems.

8.title: A Song of Ass and Fire
8.description: The console wars are heating up in South Park. Princess Kenny's betrayal has left Cartman out for revenge. The kids prepare for an epic battle where one faction's favorite gaming device will come out on top. Will Stan and Kyle's friendship survive Black Friday?

9.title: Titties and Dragons
9.description: The doors to the mall will finally open for the biggest Black Friday sale in history. The boys are divided over which gaming device to buy and a bloody battle will determine whether Xbox or Sony will be the winner.

10.title: The Hobbit
10.description: Wendy tries to prove a point about how much pressure little girls feel to look like celebrities. Her latest soapbox issue gets her in trouble with everyone at school. It also gets Clyde a new girlfriend.

1.title: Go Fund Yourself
1.description: After Cartman and the boys name their new company, they just sit back and watch the funding roll in. The owner of the Washington Redskins football team demands that they change the name but Cartman digs in his heels. The Washington Redskins may never mean the same thing ever again.

2.title: Gluten Free Ebola
2.description: Mr. Mackey is now gluten-free and everyone is annoyed when he won’t quit preaching about how great he feels. But, after witnessing a disturbing demonstration of what happens to your body when you do eat gluten, South Park becomes the first town in America to go gluten-free.

3.title: The Cissy
3.description: Stan is searching for answers about how a person who he’s always known to be one thing could suddenly identify with another. In the meantime, the pressure of holding on to a giant secret is starting to get to Randy.

4.title: Handicar
4.description: Timmy's idea to raise money for the summer camp has everyone in South Park trying out the latest trend in transportation. Timmy's success makes him a lot of enemies and a bloodbath of epic proportions is on the horizon.

5.title: The Magic Bush
5.description: Cartman and Butters get their hands on a drone and can’t resist the urge to take it for a spin around the neighborhood.

6.title: Freemium isn't free
6.description: Stan is addicted to the latest app to hit the market. Meanwhile, Terrance and Phillip aren't feeling so good about the fortune they’re making on their new mobile game.

7.title: Grounded Vindaloop
7.description: Butters is convinced that he’s living in a virtual reality. When he suddenly goes rogue and wreaks havoc at home and all over South Park, everyone struggles to figure out what’s real.

8.title: Cock Magic
8.description: Kenny excels at playing the game Magic: The Gathering. He has the boys’ full attention until a new, hard-core activity gets in the way. When Wendy tries to get Stan to pay attention to what she’s doing, she realizes that what he does with his guy friends always comes first.

9.title: #REHASH
9.description: Kyle can't figure out why Ike and his friends want to watch people comment on things going on around them rather than experience it for themselves. Meanwhile, the Marsh family needs money after Stan spent it all on freemium games so, Randy is forced to perform live to bring in some cash.

10.title: #HappyHolograms
10.description: Still burning over Ike calling him a Grandpa, Kyle teams up with some heavy hitters in the entertainment industry to create the most extravagant televised Holiday Spectacular ever. He’s sure that this event will be just the thing to bring families together again. Meanwhile, multiple holograms are still on the loose in South Park.

1.title: Stunning and Brave
1.description: There is a new principal at the helm of South Park Elementary. He forces the boys to confront the damage they’ve done through their history of racism and unconscious bias. It is the most stunning and brave South Park ever.

2.title: Where My Country Gone?
2.description: Mr. Garrison wants to build a wall to keep out all of the undocumented immigrants.

3.title: The City Part of Town
3.description: As the town is gentrifying around him, Kenny attempts to climb out of the cycle of poverty by taking a job at City Wok.

4.title: You're Not Yelping
4.description: There’s a new kid in school and his parents have opened a restaurant in the recently gentrified part of town. Cartman now considers himself the top on-line restaurant reviewer in South Park.

5.title: Safe Space
5.description: Randy has to deal with uncomfortable confrontations every time he shops at the new Whole Foods. Cartman seeks Butters's help in making a safe space.

6.title: Tweek x Craig
6.description: A rumor about a homosexual relationship between Craig Tucker and Tweek Tweak has spread throughout the town of South Park. Meanwhile, Eric Cartman's Cupid counterpart tries to start a homosexual relationship with him.

7.title: Naughty Ninjas
7.description: The terrorist group ISIS takes notice when the boys are playing Ninjas. Meanwhile, Officer Barbrady is fired from his position for shooting a Latino-American kindergartner, and the PC citizens of South Park decide to get rid of their police department.

8.title: Sponsored Content
8.description: Jimmy is sent to the principal’s office for using an inappropriate word in the school paper. His integrity as a newsman runs head on into PC Principal's ideology. Will Jimmy be the undoing of PC Principal?

9.title: Truth and Advertising
9.description: PC Principal disappears along with 2 fourth grade students. The latest news in the school paper sets the boys on a search to find their two missing classmates. Being the crack reporter that he is, Jimmy sets out to learn everything he can about what makes Leslie tick. Meanwhile, Principal Victoria and Mr. Garrison return to a South Park that has become unrecognizable.

10.title: PC Principal Final Justice
10.description: PC Principal is back with a vengeance and the citizens of South Park feel safer when armed. The gentrification of South Park is pricing Randy right out of town. Meanwhile, Kyle’s distrust of Stan has broken their friendship and thrown Kyle into a dangerous alliance.

1.title: Member Berries
1.description: Garrison is still on the campaign trail as the National Anthem gets a reboot by an American Icon.

2.title: Skank Hunt
2.description: The boys decide they have to take down Cartman, but meanwhile, Skank Hunt takes his reign of terror global.

3.title: The Damned
3.description: Gerald is thrilled with the media attention as he continues to troll everyone and anyone.

4.title: Wieners Out
4.description: Kyle feels tremendous guilt over the rift between the boys and the girls. When he tries to bring them together, things only get worse. The boys finally band together to stand up for their rights.

5.title: Douche and a Danish
5.description: The kids get pulled in to the search for the notorious Skankhunt42. Meanwhile, Gerald joins forces with the other trolls to stop Denmark from launching TrollTrace.com.

6.title: Fort Collins
6.description: An entire city in Colorado gets hacked. Gerald and Cartman may lose everything when their complete history of internet activity becomes public.

7.title: Oh, Jeez
7.description: PC Principal tries one more time to make peace between the boys and the girls. Meanwhile, Gerald comes face-to-face with the Troll Hunter.

8.title: Members Only
8.description: Gerald tries anything to escape the Troll Hunter’s revenge. Meanwhile, Cartman and Heidi make their way to SpaceX to try to get on the first rocket leaving for Mars.

9.title: Not Funny
9.description: Cartman is certain Heidi can solve the problem to getting them to Mars because she's really smart and really funny. Gerald tries to save himself by reasoning with the Troll Hunter, while Mr. Garrison explores his new found military power.

10.title: The End of Serialization as We Know It
10.description: As TROLLTRACE goes live, Sheila logs on to see Gerald's on-line activity. At SpaceX, Cartman tries to convince the scientists that going to Mars is a bad idea. And defying their mom, Kyle and Ike get all the kids together to try to save the world from certain destruction.

1.title: White People Renovating Houses
1.description: Randy comes to grips with what it means to be white in today’s society.

2.title: Put It Down
2.description: When Tweek is caught in the middle of a petty conflict, it drives his relationship with Craig to the brink.

3.title: Holiday Special
3.description: In a return to form, a forbidden love story between a white man and a Native American man unfolds. However, the boys' story exploits people's misery for laughs. 4 ½ out of 5 stars. A-

4.title: Franchise Prequel
4.description: Professor Chaos has found the perfect tool to spread lies and misinformation about Coon and Friends. In trying to save their reputation, the boys come face to face with Mark Zuckerberg.

5.title: Hummels & Heroin
5.description: Drugs are flowing into South Park. A passionate young health advocate has traced the source of these illegal meds and is about to expose Stan Marsh.

6.title: Sons a Witches
6.description: This year at the traditional Halloween get together, a witch casts a spell that terrorizes the town and ruins Halloween for the boys. Cartman sees a way to use the witch’s power to his advantage.

7.title: Doubling Down
7.description: Kyle is playing with fire when he gets in the middle of Cartman and Heidi's relationship.

8.title: Moss Piglets
8.description: Jimmy and Timmy’s experiment could win them first prize in the annual science fair.

9.title: SUPER HARD PCness
9.description: PC Principal is wrestling with some unfamiliar feelings. Meanwhile, boys will be boys except for Kyle who, for the first time, seems to see things differently from the rest of his friends.

10.title: Splatty Tomato
10.description: The children of South Park claim to have seen Mr. Garrison lurking around town. The townspeople are angry that the President is scaring their children.

1.title: Dead Kids
1.description: Randy is desperate to help Sharon get her emotions under control and Cartman unexpectedly fails his math test.

2.title: A Boy And A Priest
2.description: A very special relationship has developed between Butters and the Parish Priest. When the town finds the church doors locked and no sign of the pair, they call in the Catholic Church..

3.title: The Problem With a Poo
3.description: Mr. Hankey’s offensive behavior puts him in jeopardy of being fired as the Director of the Annual Christmas Pageant.

4.title: Tegridy Farms
4.description: Butters is selling vape pens and all kinds of fruity-flavored vape accessories at school. Meanwhile, Randy decides he should move the family to the country and take up farming.

5.title: The Scoots
5.description: The kids plan to use the latest revolution in mobility to get more candy on Halloween than they have ever gotten before.

6.title: Time to Get Cereal
6.description: When dead citizens start popping up all over town, the boys realize they need Al Gore's help. The boys are willing to do almost anything to save the town, and themselves, but it may be just too late.

7.title: Nobody Got Cereal?
7.description: The boys break out of jail and are on the run from the police and ManBearPig; Satan steps up to help the boys and the rest of South Park.

8.title: Buddha Box
8.description: Cartman just can’t deal with people any longer. They get in the way of what’s most important in his life.

9.title: Unfulfilled
9.description: The citizens of South Park are enjoying all the perks of being a company town when the Amazon Fulfillment Center moves in. Everything is just swell until the contradictions inherent in capitalism threaten to bring down the entire system down.

10.title: Bike Parade
10.description: Despite the chaos at the Amazon Fulfillment Center, the Bike Parade is still on. The boys' chance of winning is in jeopardy when Kenny resists commercialism in solidarity with the striking workers.

1.title: Mexican Joker
1.description: At Tegridy Farms, Randy struggles to cope with other South Park citizens growing their own weed at home, and after being "insulted" by Towelie, starts coming to terms with the fact that he might be a towel. Meanwhile, Cartman decides to pull a prank on Kyle by having the US ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) team detain his family at a detention center alongside several Mexican immigrant kids.

2.title: Band In China
2.description: Randy lands himself in big trouble on a visit to China. Meanwhile, Stan starts a band to work out his frustration over having to move away from South Park.

3.title: Shots!!!
3.description: This week, Randy revels in a Tegridy Farms milestone. Meanwhile, Cartman stands his ground and refuses to get a shot.

4.title: Let Them Eat Goo
4.description: The citizens of South Park are moving toward a completely plant-based diet. Cartman is pretty sure the new food in the cafeteria gave him a heart attack.

5.title: Tegridy Farms Halloween Special
5.description: It’s Halloween and Randy is dealing with his daughter’s marijuana problem. Butters gets an unexpected surprise when he visits the Egyptian Artifact exhibit at the Denver Museum.

6.title: Season Finale
6.description: The Mayor has evidence that Randy blew up his neighbor’s yards in protest over homegrown weed and then blamed it on a Mexican Joker. Now the citizens of South Park have had enough of Randy and Tegridy Farms and they just want to lock him up.

7.title: Board Girls
7.description: In the season opener, an even stronger woman causes big problems for PC Principal. Cartman, Stan, and the rest of the boys meet their match when some of the girls join their board gamers club.

8.title: Turd Burglars
8.description: Kyle’s mom looks so good after her fecal transplant that everyone wants to get their hands on her goods. Cartman and the boys jump into the quest for the best microbiome.

9.title: Basic Cable
9.description: Scott Malkinson’s future with the new girl in his class depends on him getting the latest and greatest streaming platform. Scott’s dad works for the local cable company and refuses to move beyond basic cable.

10.title: Christmas Snow
10.description: It's a bleak Christmas Season in South Park this year and it's all Santa's fault. He is single-handedly stealing the joy from the holiday. The town just wants their Christmas Spirit back but that will take a Christmas miracle.
